en.value: I'm going to work. See you later!
We're now going to learn how to use the present continuous. We use this tense to talk about temporary actions and things that are happening at the time of speaking, like in the examples below.
What is Alex doing at home?
Yes, of course, but later. I'm [k]working[/k] now!
Staying: she is staying at a flat in the city centre.
I'm staying at a flat in the city centre, at the moment.
to say you are preparing a meal
Some verbs normally end in an "e". When we use these verbs in the present continuous, we remove the "e" before we add the "ing".
Cooking: she is cooking dinner for some friends.
Describe what you are doing today using the present continuous tense. Write or record your response.
Studying: she is studying German at university.
Select the things you can do around the house.
We do this when we're tired.
He is going to the bathroom.
No, I'm working from [k]home[/k]. Why? What are you [k]doing[/k]?
I'm not having a great time. Can we go home?
We're not cooking this evening. We're going out for dinner!
The man is working from home. They are making dinner.
Saying what we and others are doing, activities / jobs around the house - Present continuous tense
Select the words in the correct order.
He's staying at home today because he's ill.
He is going to the supermarket.
Select the correct words to fill the gaps.
Which verb has a similar meaning to “preparing food”?
I'm really [k]enjoying[/k] cooking, at the moment. Let's do that. What are you doing?
I'm [k]cooking|making dinner|cooking dinner|making food|preparing food|making lunch|cooking lunch[/k] in the kitchen.
Don't forget, when we use verbs that normally end in an "e" in the present continuous, we remove the "e" before we add the "ing".
Type the present continuous form of this verb.
Listen to the audio. What is Mira doing at the time of speaking?
Hannah and her partner Lucas are on the phone.
That sounds great. Do you want to go out for dinner or cook?
I'm just [k]going[/k] to the supermarket. Let's have dinner together later!
We do this when we remove dirt.
He is reading in his bedroom.
Match the pairs of words / phrases.
Listen and select the correct word(s) to fill the gap.
Describe what you can see in the photographs.
I'm quite tired. I[k]'m[/k] [k]going[/k] to bed now.
Fill in the gap using the audio.
When we form questions in the present continuous, we simply take the verb and place it at the beginning of the sentence, like this:
I'm [k]cleaning[/k] the bathrooms! If you're staying at home, can you come and help me, please?
He is looking for a supermarket.
to make a house a home
We form the present continuous like this: form of "to be" + verb + "ing"
Present simple: I work from home every Tuesday.
Listen to the dialogue and fill in the gaps.
Tom is working from home today.
Enjoying: he is not enjoying himself.
Fill in the gap using the hint.

To recap: we use the present simple to talk about things that are generally true, or that occur regularly. We use the present continuous to talk about temporary actions or things that are happening at the time of speaking.
I am [k]having[/k] dinner with some friends tonight.
Alex and his mum are calling to each other in the house.
We do this when we don't leave the house.
Yuna is using the present continuous in this audio because she is talking about an action that is happening at the time of speaking. What is this action?
He's not reading a book at the moment.
Match the words and expressions with context we would use them in.
This action is happening at the time of speaking.
I'm just [k]opening[/k] the shop. I should go actually. See you later!
They're [k]living[/k] with me, at the moment!
He is cooking in the kitchen.
Select the words which have a similar meaning to “preparing food”.
We're cooking lunch with some friends.
She [k]is having[/k] dinner with her mum.

When we talk about a "house" we are talking about the actual building. However, the word "home" refers to the place where you live (whether it be a house or a flat) or the place where you come from like the word "hometown".
They're making dinner in the kitchen.
Fill in the gap using the image.
I'm tired. I'm going to bed now.
Rodrigo is using the present continuous because he is talking about an action that is happening at the time of speaking. What is that action?
Present continuous: I'm working from home at the moment.
Here are a couple of idiomatic expressions you can use with the word "home". Try and use one when you next speak to a native English speaker!
Okay. Are you [k]going to work[/k] today?
We do this when we prepare something to eat.
I'm going to [k]work[/k]. See you later!
He is cooking dinner for his partner.
He is having the lasagne. - Is he having the lasagne?
They're studying medicine at university. - Are they studying medicine at university?
We form negatives in the present continuous like this: form of "to be" + "not" + verb + "ing"
